title: It Starts Up; It Downloads Mail; BUT There's Nothing There!
content:
As I just said: It tells me that there's Stuff downloading, but NOTHING shows up. [See attachment; [T-BIRD-01.png]; this may make a reply to this rather difficult]. How do I get the lists back.

Thankx [I'll be checking back]

The Gray Cat << tmc@att.net >>
creator: WriteStuff

title: Thunderbird accidentally moved spam into trash
content: I've stupidly accidentally moved spam into the trash folder. How can I restore it to the correct location? Dragging and dropping doesn't work and neither does a rename? Help....
creator: iangtooley

title: When deleting an email, another email higher up in the list - which isn't selected - also gets deleted
content:
When I go through my email list, I delete the currently highlighted (selected) email by using the delete button or clicking on the delete button above the email message.

As I do this, every few messages, instead of just the selected email being deleted, another email higher up the list (newer in the list) also gets deleted.

I have noticed this with a recent update of Thunderbird in the last month or two.
creator: neilnjt

title: SuperNova appearance
content: I jsut installed SuperNova and the fonts on the screen became much larger as did all the fonts on the home screen. How can I change those fonts so that the menus are not taking up so much of the screen?
creator: mozfan2

title: Cannot reduce the message list pane
content:
I upgraded to version 115.2.2 (64 bits), on a Windows 10 OS.

I used to be able to reduce the pane of the message list, so that I could expand the contents of a selected message. But now it has a lower limit, where I cannot push the line up further.

Attached is an image showing the line of concern. I could drag it down, but no further up. How could I change this behavior?

Thanks!
creator: yeohakoon

title: Cannot access hotmail via Thunderbird due to cookie settings in browser
content:
I upgraded to Thunderbird 115.2.2 (64 bit). The OS is Windows 10, version 22H2.

Now I cannot access hotmail via Thunderbird because it required me to allow cookies in the Firefox browser. This is kind of weird as these are two different apps.

My Firefox cookie setting is 'standard'. Wonder what does that have to do with Thunderbird?

Attached is the message that showed up. Kindly assist. Thanks!
creator: yeohakoon

title: Thunderbird 115

title: Latest update
content: Updated Thunderbird now everything on my screen is HUGE. I can't read it or even find my Inbox. I should have known better!! How do I get everything back before I did this?
creator: AZCowboy

title: Toolbar disappeared after recent Thunderbird update
content: The toolbar that contains the icons for "Get Mail", "Write" and "Chat" has disappeared from my Thunderbird setup after a recent update (to 115.2.2). I have tried various options under "View" and "Settings" to get it back without success. How do I re-add it?
creator: hal90001

title: Notification of mail in inbox
content: Having reinstalled Thunderbird, the icon on the task bar would usually show a number in a small red circle saying that email has arrived in the inbox. May be only 1 email, or it could be 5, or 25..... This notification is not showing any email arriving in the inbox. How can this be restored? Thank you.Kind regards Paul
creator: southwind573

title: Size of Fonts to keep in settings
content: I have multiple Email accounts configured in my Thhunderbird account including Gmail and also official mail IDs. I was facing problems to see the small size of fonts in mails and then i used to zoom in and see on regular basis. Based on some internet suggestion i have changed the font setting (all 14) as per the enclosed photo (Thunderbird setting> General> Language & Setting> Advanced- screen shot) please confirm if it is correctly kept or i should change some. my laptop is on Windows 11 -- Thanks and Regards
creator: scy321
